actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law

official_title: To amend section 312 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide for the exemption of the Government knowledge requirement for naturalization of persons over fifty years of age who have been lawful permanent residents in the United States for at least twenty years.

summary.text: Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to waive the government knowledge naturalization requirement for persons over age 50 who have resided in the United States as permanent residents for at least 20 years.

titles.title: To amend section 312 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide for the exemption of the Government knowledge requirement for naturalization of persons over fifty years of age who have been lawful permanent residents in the United States for at least twenty years.
